entry.title: ROSEBURG STATE OF THE CITY ADDRESS OFFERED MONDAY

entry.title: STATE REPRESENTATIVE BOOMER WRIGHT ANNOUNCES RETIREMENT AFTER 2026
entry.summary: January 13, 2026 3:30 a.m. State Representative Boomer Wright has announced his retirement from the Oregon State Legislature after 2026. The ninth district Republican has represented parts of Coos, Lane and Douglas County – including the Reedsport area, since 2020. In a release Wright said, “I thank all of you for the support, friendship, advice...

entry.title: Police Log: January 9 - 11, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg Police Log: Jan. 9-11, 2026. Incidents included multiple warrant arrests, DUII investigations, theft and probation violations, trespass and prohibited camping calls, and non-injury crashes, according to City of Roseburg Police Logs.

entry.title: Tractor Supply on Track to Open Roseburg Store in March
entry.summary: Tractor Supply Company is set to open its Roseburg store in March, with a soft opening planned for March 21 and a grand opening on March 28. The store will be located in North Roseburg Plaza and is expected to create about 15 local jobs.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Arrested After Knife “Joke” at Del Taco
entry.summary: A 33 year old Roseburg man was arrested after police say he displayed a knife and demanded money from an employee at a Del Taco, later claiming he was joking. The employee asked him to leave, and officers later arrested the man, who also admitted to an earlier theft.

entry.title: Wrapping up a year of reading
entry.summary: I read 153 books last year. Not a record, but I was pleased with the quality of the titles I chose.

entry.title: Building, evolving and serving: Con-Vey celebrates 80 years of business
entry.summary: Con-Vey may have started as a fabrication and machine shop focused on repair work for local mills, but 80 years later it is a full-service industrial automation provider nationally recognized for its contributions to the manufacturing industry.

entry.title: Safe Routes for School grant applications open soon
entry.summary: Oregon Department of Transportation (ODOT) announced that Safe Routes to School grant applications will open in February 2026.

entry.title: Douglas County population estimates decrease as Oregon gains residents
entry.summary: Research shows approximately 17,000 new residents flocked to Oregon over the past year, but it also shows that they did not come to Douglas County.

entry.title: Q&A: Rep. Court Boice talks about Republican influences in the upcoming short session
entry.summary: This interview, originally broadcast on News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN, has been edited for brevity and style. For the full interview, go to kqennewsradio.com. Court Boice, R-Gold Beach, is State Representative for Oregon’s House District 1. He first…
